Please...Stop posting rar files or GTFO! Secene groups use rar because they post to newsgroups. Rars have no useful purpose in torrents other than hiding cracks and patches from Anti-virus progs. All the other reason given for using rars ONLY APPLY TO NEWSGROUPS! Back when The Scene started, newsgroup servers restricted the size of attachment in messages and RAR was the only compression utility that would easily split large files.
Scene groups sever a useful purpose, but people who just take these rar files and post them as torrents just make more work for torrent users. Please UNRAR before you post.

To the noobs who are complaining about RAR files. Most if not ALL torrents which are uploaded to ANY tracker, COME FROM USENET!... Usenet has a 15MB per article size restriction. This means, when someone posts an 'article' with an attachment (much like email with an attachment) on Usenet then their 'attachment' MUST NOT EXCEED 15MB! ...

This is why ALOT of torrents come in Multi-RAR form. The uploader is simply passing on the exact archive he got either from Usenet or from a friend who has a Usenet account. So stop fucking complaining about "ohh in this day in age we're still dealing with rars" you bunch of arrogant misguided pricks! Have a cup of concrete and HARDEN THE FUCK UP! 

RAR is not just used to split files up for EASIER TRANSMISSION. It's also a COMPRESSION FORMAT you bunch of dumbarses.. 

I bet you lot are the same fucking arseholes who complain about "Ohh why is this file so big?!" Jesus christ.... wake the fuck up and understand that you HAVE to almost ALWAYS sacrifice something for something else (e.g filesize for quality, quality for filesize).

Goddamn, every torrent comment section has these fucking morons who really don't understand how shit is done DESPITE THERE BEING THE WORLDS LARGEST LIBRARY ONLINE TO LOOK UP SHIT!!! A.K.A GOOGLE AND/OR WIKI!

Try researching a little before posting retarded bitchy comments.. Oh wait, most of you are 'too lazy' to do that and would probably respond with "Oh why should i waste my time...." in which case, turn off your computer, get rid of it and go outside in the real world. Clearly you're not cut out for how the internet works.

BTW: Thanks for the Upload, Uploader! :)
